Cuerpo: Date: Thu, 21 Nov 1996 22:18:02 GMT Server: NCSA/1.4.2 Content-type: text/html CSE 581 Home Page CSE 581: Parallel Computation in Image Processing Welcome to the 581 Home Page! This is the World Wide Web ("the Web" for short) hypermedia document for CSE 581 and contains information about the class. Schedule Information On October 31, November 7, and 9, class will begin a half-hour earlier than normal. On November 1, we will meet at 9:00 and have a guest speaker, Prof. Ze-Nian Li of Simon Fraser University in Burnaby, B.C., Canada. Tuesday, November 14: no class. November 16 at 9:00. algorithms, Tuesday, November 28. Topics: Completion of overview of neural network architectures. Embedding of neural networks in meshes and pyramids. Brief treatment of iconic/symbolic computation. Finding term project topics During the week of October 12-18 students should be actively exploring one or more topics for the term project. Written descriptions of topics should be handed in on Tuesday, October 24. A template for the writeups is available here. This is a convenient way to implement and study distributed algorithms. The ZPL language is a good language in which to implement 2-D array-oriented algorithms on the Intel Paragon. Some online information for the MasPar MP-2 is at the University of Tennessee. This resource was found by Neal Friedman. Here are some errors in and corrections to the course notes. These should be started during the week of October 16. The final exam is scheduled for Wednesday, December 13 from 10:30 to 12:20 in our normal class meeting room.
